<Extension()> Public Function DownloadToDirectoryAsync (client As ShareDirectoryClient, waitUntil As WaitUntil, localDirectoryPath As String, Optional options As ShareDirectoryClientTransferOptions = Nothing, Optional cancellationToken As CancellationToken = Nothing) As Task(Of TransferOperation)

static member DownloadToDirectoryAsync : Azure.Storage.Files.Shares.ShareDirectoryClient * Azure.WaitUntil * string * Azure.Storage.DataMovement.Files.Shares.ShareDirectoryClientTransferOptions * System.Threading.CancellationToken -> System.Threading.Tasks.Task<Azure.Storage.DataMovement.TransferOperation>

Docs.param: Indicates whether this invocation should wait until the transfer is complete to return or return immediately.
The full path to the local directory where files will be dowloaded.
Options which control the container download.
Cancels starting the operation or if is set to , cancels waiting for the operation. Cancelling this token does not cancel the operation itself.
Docs.summary: Downloads the contents of a share directory.
Docs.returns: A instance which contains information about the transfer and its status.
Docs.remarks: This is an async long-running operation which means the operation may not be complete when this methods returns. If is set to , the method will return as soon as a transfer is started and can be used to wait for the transfer to complete. If is set to , the method will wait for the entire transfer to complete. In either case, the caller must check the status of the transfer using the returned instance to determine if the transfer completed successfully or not. This method will not throw an exception if the transfer fails, but the will indicate a failure.
